website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, enduring, and easy to use, these orange tent spikes are the best way to secure your tent on the beach.
pros: Best for sandy or snowy terrain
6 holes per stake for custom rope tying options
cons: A poor choice for camping on hard ground

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: We used these on the beach in Corpus Christi. At first we felt confident the stakes would work and counted our blessings that we decided to order them. Unfotunately, the stakes ended up being worthless. Our tent came down on top of us hours after we set it up and all the stakes were left twisted pieces of trash. We ended up having to sleep out on the sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flat out gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys held up our tent in soft beach sand with 30 mph winds over a two day trip. Never had to hammer them down a second time. They're also lightweight and easy to store. Flat out gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Great surface area for sand and loose soil. Not the most durable.
customer_reviews.text: Good surface area for holding steadfast in sand or loose soil. However, do be aware that they bend very easily. In compressed sand I pushed them down with my flip flops on and two of the four bent without much downward pressure. Disappointing after only a couple times of use.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Held tent down during high winds
customer_reviews.text: These are great product for holding a tent in the sand. We just visited Pismo Beach and endured horrible winds during this past summer. Sand flying everywhere. But these held our tent in. Although the fabric of our tent still swayed back and forth. These held the tent down.
customer_reviews.author: Mariam

customer_reviews.title: My precious! Pretty pieces of metal.
customer_reviews.text: Conclusion: Big, strong and not oxidize. Pros + Aluminum, will not oxidize + Strong build, hard to bend + These are large, 2 hands long, thick as 2 fingers wide. Cons + Probably the size might be a con for some tent users, depending on their tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Buyr

customer_reviews.title: Tent stayed standing through a tropical storm.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use these on our last camping trip. We stayed in a tent in campgrounds Ocean Lakes (Myrtle Beach, SC) and Cherrystone(Cape Charles, VA) last week during tropical storm Cindy. We had rains in SC and 25 mph winds on the Chesapeake Bay. These stakes kept our tent from falling over. I'm buying more. I included a video from inside the tent during gusty winds.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kershaw

customer_reviews.title: Held very well
customer_reviews.text: I used in snow. First I packed the snow down in my camp area, then I put these in at a pretty steep angle. Held better than regular stakes do in dirt. I think they "set" after some time too, as I had to pry them out in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E. Polk

customer_reviews.title: BENT in the sand!
customer_reviews.text: These stakes are a great concept, but made out of NON-durable material. Aluminum can be a strong material, when using the right density. For an application like sand stakes for my tent, these things did NOT hold up well. There was no wind, only tension from a hitch knot. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for sand!
customer_reviews.text: They look too thin in effors to handle the task of anchoring a canopy under windy conditions, however the set held up exceptionally well, and don't take up much space at all. The orange is cool looking!!
customer_reviews.author: A Modern Journeyman

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Tent stakes. Just like those red one's, only cheaper. I use it for cat holes and works great.
customer_reviews.author: SFreed

customer_reviews.title: They worked in 30mph winds and held everything great. My only issue is they are easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Took these to San Padre N Sea Shore. They worked in 30mph winds and held everything great. My only issue is they are easy to bend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well when I took a tent to the beach. It kept the tent on the ground, even in windy weather. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stakes for beach/sand
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to the beach to use with this beach tent -  They are awesome! Easily slide in and out of the sand but held the tent in 25 mph winds.
customer_reviews.author: Laura F

customer_reviews.title: Great trowel.
customer_reviews.text: I use one for my backpacker's trowel. While just a bit heavier than the popular spade trowel, it dug a deeper hole and was easier on my hand. (And it's a backup tent stake if I need it.)
customer_reviews.author: Laura W.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for sand
customer_reviews.text: My second set. If you camp in sand these far outperform any standard stakes I've see. I especially use these to stake my tarp which can catch a lot of wind.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: Gotta tell ya, this is a well made product! So many people have been impressed with the quality. Not a bad one in the bunch, either! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CR Mainwearing

customer_reviews.title: Great for its
customer_reviews.text: All it takes is some light pressure in the sand to keep the tent down. Pushing too hard will bend the stakes in the sand. Great for its purpose
customer_reviews.author: TML

customer_reviews.title: Work well for my use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for me. I attached to pvc pipe to make polish (drinking game).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Daigle

customer_reviews.title: Great for snow camping
customer_reviews.text: Bargain deal for sand/snow stakes. Good size/weight. I added a line loop through stake so it can dbl duty as a snow anchor/mini picket for my tent guy lines.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Well made and effective in the sand.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised... worked great in the sand. I use them for guying antennas for portable radio use. I will order more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bent on the 2nd time using them at the beach. It was windy but still shouldn't have bent.
customer_reviews.author: twillgolf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for more stability with a tent in sand, held up well for entire trip.
customer_reviews.author: bklvrpw

customer_reviews.title: I used these stakes at cape point camping ground nc ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these stakes at cape point camping ground nc. They held against strong winds. I can't say the same for the tent is used.
customer_reviews.author: Boys' mom

customer_reviews.title: These stakes hold it down
customer_reviews.text: These things are bomber! Took them to the deep Sahara desert and they did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were great for my first venture in beach camping - I ...
customer_reviews.text: These were great for my first venture in beach camping - I wish I had ordered a second set though!
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly in the sand. They held my shade tent like they should have. And they were easy to use and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: I use these stakes all the time
customer_reviews.text: I live around Moab, UT, where sandy camping and night wind are the norm, so these stakes are necessary. I have used these in 50 mph gusts so far, and I can tell my tent poles will give out before these stakes. They are light enough to throw in you pack for backpacking, if you really need to. They also work great for my EZ-UP tent with plenty of paracord. I have used these to dock boats, leash my dog when I camp without a tent, stake a hanging bear vault; these stakes simply work. I look forward to trying these in the snow up in the mountains this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Bull

customer_reviews.title: Quality, lightweight stakes.
customer_reviews.text: Quality, lightweight stakes. I've used these for sandbar camping and they've worked great as expected.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great for sand tenting
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping in the sand! Tent stayed put in some very strong winds. Lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Heslin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, although we did also find some at ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, although we did also find some at Bass Pro Shop which worked equally as well and much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Braun

customer_reviews.title: Great for beach use
customer_reviews.text: Great for beach use. Did a fantastic job of anchoring our large Kelty Mirage Sunshade at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie A

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Held the tenr down during high winds in loose sand. Did there job flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good, held tent well in mild windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Good, held tent well in mild windy conditions. Used plastic hammer also from Amazon. Used on the beach so not a hard surface and tops of stakes started to bend in after hammering in...
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet but seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.author: Christopher h.

customer_reviews.title: nice and heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are bigger than I thought they would be, but very nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Marzipan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They were perfect!! Gone are the days when our little beach tent would go flying away.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to setup cabana on a sand beach. Held well even in the windy conditions. Cant complain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work great. I used them at the beach last weekend to hold down a 10' canopy and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for actual tent rings
customer_reviews.text: Didn't consider they are too wide to fit through the rings of the tent. Still works to tie off the rain fly tho. Also no Velcro strap included.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie Savignano

customer_reviews.title: Bends easily
customer_reviews.text: They are substantial and solid, but one bent on me as I was pushing it into the ground. I was using my hands and body weight. Disappointed that I will have to be more careful with the remaining 3 stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan N

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME in snow
customer_reviews.text: Used some of these over the weekend on a winter backpacking trip. Instead of dead-manning the anchors in the snow I simply just stuck the stakes in, and the snow concretes around them. I only had 4 of these around the corners of my tent and 2 guy out lines on the vestibules and my tent didnt move and inch in 50+ mph winds.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Harwell

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit my canopy tent but we found other uses for them.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Shanahan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in the Grand Canyon sand!!
customer_reviews.text: Used these sand stakes on the Colorado River in the Grand Canyon this Spring in several sand storms and they performed perfectly. Other folks on the trip mentioned that they were going to buy this product as soon as returning from the rafting trip.
customer_reviews.author: Herb McGilton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: FYI, these are huge. Not sure if I missed the specs but they add about 6oz to your pack.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sand stakes.
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome sand stakes! I got a SportBrella and the sand stakes that came with it are close to worthless, but THESE stakes are great! Strong, lightweight, long enough, no rough edges, and the orange color makes them easy to find in the sand. Perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bend at soon as you touch them.
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely thin and if you can't beat them with your hand then they are useless. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Didn't have a lot of wind, but they seemed pretty solid in the sand
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have alot of wind but, they seemed pretty solid in the sand
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Strong for being Aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Stay in the Ground good. They are wide and did not fit inside tent stake loop. Had to use paracord to tie to the stake and loop
customer_reviews.author: Gene

product_meta.title: Bluecell 4pcs Orange Color Aluminum Tent Stakes for Camping in Snow and Sand Tent Boating Hiking Backpacking Picnic Shelter Shade Canopy Outdoor Activity
product_meta.description: These tent stakes are special designed for camping in soft land just like sand or snow. The wider and longer “U” style design makes the stake stronger than the normal ones. You can enjoy your kayak camping on the beach with them. Each package includes 4pcs stakes.
feature_bullets: 4 Orange Aluminum Tent Stakes for Sand or Snow use
Wider and longer "U" style design makes the stakes stronger
6 Holes for a variety of rigging options
Length: 12", Width: .5", Diameter of the hole: 0.42", Weight of each Stake: 1.76 ounces

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
